verses.verse: When Jethro<WH3503>, the priest<WH3548> of Midian<WH4080>, Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859>, heard<WH8085> of all that God<WH430> had done<WH6213> for Moses<WH4872>, and for Israel<WH3478> his people<WH5971>, and that the LORD<WH3068> had brought<WH3318> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt<WH4714>;
Then Jethro<WH3503>, Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859>, took<WH3947> Zipporah<WH6855>, Moses'<WH4872> wife<WH802>, after<WH310> he had sent her back<WH7964>,
And her two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>; of which the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Gershom<WH1647>; for he said<WH559>, I have been an alien<WH1616> in a strange<WH5237> land<WH776>:
And the name<WH8034> of the other<WH259> was Eliezer<WH461>; for the God<WH430> of my father<WH1>, said he, was mine help<WH5828>, and delivered<WH5337> me from the sword<WH2719> of Pharaoh<WH6547>:

And Jethro<WH3503>, Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859>, came<WH935> with his sons<WH1121> and his wife<WH802> unto Moses<WH4872> into the wilderness<WH4057>, where he encamped<WH2583> at the mount<WH2022> of God<WH430>:
And he said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, I thy father in law<WH2859> Jethro<WH3503> am come<WH935> unto thee, and thy wife<WH802>, and her two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> with her.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> his father in law<WH2859>, and did obeisance<WH7812>, and kissed<WH5401> him; and they asked<WH7592> each<WH376> other<WH7453> of their welfare<WH7965>; and they came<WH935> into the tent<WH168>.

And Moses<WH4872> told<WH5608> his father in law<WH2859> all that the LORD<WH3068> had done<WH6213> unto Pharaoh<WH6547> and to the Egyptians<WH4714> for Israel's<WH3478> sake<WH182>, and all the travail<WH8513> that had come<WH4672> upon them by the way<WH1870>, and how the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5337> them.

And Jethro<WH3503> rejoiced<WH2302> for all the goodness<WH2896> which the LORD<WH3068> had done<WH6213> to Israel<WH3478>, whom he had delivered<WH5337> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And Jethro<WH3503> said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068>, who hath delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, and out of the hand<WH3027> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, who hath delivered<WH5337> the people<WH5971> from under the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>.
Now I know<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> is greater<WH1419> than all gods<WH430>: for in the thing<WH1697> wherein they dealt proudly<WH2102> he was above them.

And Jethro<WH3503>, Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859>, took<WH3947> a burnt offering<WH5930> and sacrifices<WH2077> for God<WH430>: and Aaron<WH175> came<WH935>, and all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>, to eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859> before<WH6440> God<WH430>.

¶ And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, that Moses<WH4872> sat<WH3427> to judge<WH8199> the people<WH5971>: and the people<WH5971> stood<WH5975> by Moses<WH4872> from the morning<WH1242> unto the evening<WH6153>.

And when Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859> saw<WH7200> all that he did<WH6213> to the people<WH5971>, he said<WH559>, What is this thing<WH1697> that thou doest<WH6213> to the people<WH5971>? why sittest<WH3427> thou thyself alone, and all the people<WH5971> stand<WH5324> by thee from morning<WH1242> unto even<WH6153>?
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto his father in law<WH2859>, Because the people<WH5971> come<WH935> unto me to inquire<WH1875> of God<WH430>:

When they have a matter<WH1697>, they come<WH935> unto me; and I judge<WH8199> between one<WH376> and another<WH7453>, and I do make them know<WH3045> the statutes<WH2706> of God<WH430>, and his laws<WH8451>.
And Moses'<WH4872> father in law<WH2859> said<WH559> unto him, The thing<WH1697> that thou doest<WH6213> is not good<WH2896>.

Thou wilt surely<WH5034> wear away<WH5034>, both thou, and this people<WH5971> that is with thee: for this thing<WH1697> is too heavy<WH3515> for thee; thou art not able<WH3201> to perform<WH6213> it thyself alone.

Hearken<WH8085> now unto my voice<WH6963>, I will give thee counsel<WH3289>, and God<WH430> shall be<WH1961> with thee: Be thou for the people<WH5971> to God-ward<WH4136><WH430>, that thou mayest bring<WH935> the causes<WH1697> unto God<WH430>:

And thou shalt teach<WH2094><WH853> them ordinances<WH2706> and laws<WH8451>, and shalt shew<WH3045> them the way<WH1870> wherein they must walk<WH3212>, and the work<WH4639> that they must do<WH6213>.

Moreover thou shalt provide<WH2372> out of all the people<WH5971> able<WH2428> men<WH582>, such as fear<WH3373> God<WH430>, men<WH582> of truth<WH571>, hating<WH8130> covetousness<WH1215>; and place<WH7760> such over them, to be rulers<WH8269> of thousands<WH505>, and rulers<WH8269> of hundreds<WH3967>, rulers<WH8269> of fifties<WH2572>, and rulers<WH8269> of tens<WH6235>:

And let them judge<WH8199> the people<WH5971> at all seasons<WH6256>: and it shall be, that every great<WH1419> matter<WH1697> they shall bring<WH935> unto thee, but every small<WH6996> matter<WH1697> they shall judge<WH8199>: so shall it be easier<WH7043> for thyself, and they shall bear<WH5375> the burden with thee.

If thou shalt do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>, and God<WH430> command<WH6680> thee so, then thou shalt be able<WH3201> to endure<WH5975>, and all this people<WH5971> shall also go<WH935> to their place<WH4725> in peace<WH7965>.
So Moses<WH4872> hearkened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of his father in law<WH2859>, and did<WH6213> all that he had said<WH559>.

And Moses<WH4872> chose<WH977> able<WH2428> men<WH582> out of all Israel<WH3478>, and made<WH5414> them heads<WH7218> over the people<WH5971>, rulers<WH8269> of thousands<WH505>, rulers<WH8269> of hundreds<WH3967>, rulers<WH8269> of fifties<WH2572>, and rulers<WH8269> of tens<WH6235>.

And they judged<WH8199> the people<WH5971> at all seasons<WH6256>: the hard<WH7186> causes<WH1697> they brought<WH935> unto Moses<WH4872>, but every small<WH6996> matter<WH1697><WH1992> they judged<WH8199> themselves.
¶ And Moses<WH4872> let his father in law<WH2859> depart<WH7971>; and he went<WH3212> his way into his own land<WH776>.
